subject: RE: [junit] Re: Help setting up JUnit
msgSnippet: Try including the current directory ( . ) in your classpath, as well as the junit directory CLASSPATH=.;C: Program
messageBody:
Try including the current directory (".") in your classpath, as well as the junit directory

CLASSPATH=.;C:\Program Files\j2sdk_nb\j2sdk1.4.2\junit3.8.1\junit.jar;C:\Program Files\j2sdk_nb\j2sdk1.4.2\junit3.8.1

Craig

-----Original Message-----
From: dinglek2004 [mailto:dinglek@...]
Sent: Tuesday, January 27, 2004 2:11 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Re: Help setting up JUnit


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@f...> wrote:
> On Sat, 24 Jan 2004 22:27:16 -0000, bobmcc20 <bobmcc20@y...> wrote:
>
> > Hello,
> >
> > I am using JUnit (or tying to at least) as part of one of my
college
> > classes. I read the installation document, and set the classpath
as
> > was stated. When I try to import junit.framework.* I get the
error:
> >
> > package junit.framework does not exist
> >
> > Is there any other steps to installing JUnit that I missed? I am
using
> > Windows Xp if that helps.
>
> First, welcome to the world of testing. Second, you need to give
us more
> information. Are you using the commandline or an IDE? What
exactly is
> your CLASSPATH variable?
>
> --
> Jason Rogers
>
> "So great is the ignorance, so very little the knowledge, of even
the best
> of men!" - John Wesley, "Christian Perfection"

Apologies if this gets posted twice.
I'm responding because I have encountered the same problem.
Hopefully the issue is the same.

I installed the junit 3.8.1 under the directory C:\Program
Files\j2sdk_nb\j2sdk1.4.2.

I set the CLASSPATH and Path to be:
Class path:
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\j2sdk_nb\j2sdk1.4.2\junit3.8.1\junit.jar

Path:
Path=C:\Windows\system32;C:\Windows;C:\Windows\System32
\Wbem;c:\utilities;C:\Program Files\j2sdk_nb\j2sdk1.4.2
\bin;C:\Program Files\j2sdk_nb\j2sdk1.4.2\junit3.8.1


Running the commands below in the directories listed (where x is
C:\Program Files\j2sdk_nb\j2sdk1.4.2 - removed for readability)
gives the output shown

Running from the directory:
x\junit3.8.1>java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
-----gives-----
Class not found "junit.samples.AllTests"
-----end-----


Running from the directory:
x\junit3.8.1\junit\tests>javac AllTests.java
-----gives-----
AllTests.java:17: package junit.tests.framework does not exist
suite.addTest(junit.tests.framework.AllTests.suite
());
^
AllTests.java:18: package junit.tests.runner does not exist
suite.addTest(junit.tests.runner.AllTests.suite());
^
AllTests.java:19: package junit.tests.extensions does not exist
suite.addTest(junit.tests.extensions.AllTests.suite
());
^
3 errors
-----end-----


Running from the directory:
x\junit3.8.1\junit\samples>javac AllTests.java
-----gives-----
AllTests.java:16: cannot resolve symbol
symbol : variable VectorTest
location: class junit.samples.AllTests
suite.addTest(VectorTest.suite());
^
AllTests.java:17: package junit.samples.money does not exist
suite.addTest(new TestSuite
(junit.samples.money.MoneyTest.class));
^
AllTests.java:18: package junit.tests does not exist
suite.addTest(junit.tests.AllTests.suite());
^
3 errors
-----end-----

Thanks for any help.
